name: Descendant of Soramaro
text: {1}{U}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of cards in your hand, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: "Soramaro speaks through me. Listen! And I will tell the wisdom of the ancestors."

name: Descendants' Path
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.

name: Descend upon the Sinful
text:
Exile all creatures.
Delirium — Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Above the cries, a phrase rang out: "You will all be saved."

name: Descent into Madness
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a despair counter on Descent into Madness, then each player exiles X permanents he or she controls and/or cards from his or her hand, where X is the number of despair counters on Descent into Madness.

editions.flavor: The stairs lead down in both directions.

name: Descent of the Dragons
text: Destroy any number of target creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller creates a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: Dragons emerge from tempests fully formed and terribly hungry.

name: Desecrated Earth
text: Destroy target land. Its controller discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"The land is swollen with mana, cursed relics, and secrets. If you puncture it, you never know what will burst out."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Desecration Demon
text:
Flying
At the beginning of each combat, any opponent may sacrifice a creature. If a player does, tap Desecration Demon and put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

name: Desecration Elemental
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a player casts a spell, sacrifice a creature.

editions.flavor: Its precious corpses dance like puppets to attract mindless nim prey.

name: Desecration Plague
text: Destroy target enchantment or land.

editions.flavor:
"The gods think of us as insects. Perhaps there is wisdom in that."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Desecrator Hag
text: When Desecrator Hag enters the battlefield, return to your hand the creature card in your graveyard with the greatest power. If two or more cards are tied for greatest power, you choose one of them.

editions.flavor: Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.
Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.

name: Desert
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.

name: Desert Cerodon
text: Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: The endless expanse of desert surrounding Naktamun sometimes yields threats that the gods themselves must answer.

name: Desert Drake
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Never doubt a dragon just because of its size.

name: Deserted Temple
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Untap target land.

editions.flavor: A monument to long-forgotten gods, it stands as a tribute to the fleeting nature of human ways.

name: Deserter's Quarters
text:
You may choose not to untap Deserter's Quarters during your untap step.
{6}, {T}: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Deserter's Quarters remains tapped.

editions.flavor: In Akros, the penalty for running from battle is one night's stay in the Deserter's Quarters.

name: Desertion
text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.

editions.flavor: First the insult, then the injury.
First the insult, then the injury.
First the insult, then the injury.
First the insult, then the injury.

name: Desert Nomads
text:
Desertwalk
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Desert Nomads by Deserts.

name: Desert Sandstorm
text: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.

editions.flavor: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

name: Desert Twister
text: Destroy target permanent.

editions.flavor: Massive, mindless, and imbued with one terrible purpose.

The magical dust clouds Mercadian mages use to traverse the plane generate storms that devastate the surrounding terrain. But as long as the storms don't touch the mountain, the nobles simply don't care.
Massive, mindless, and imbued with one terrible purpose.
Massive, mindless, and imbued with one terrible purpose.

name: Desiccated Naga
text: {3}{B}: Target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life. Activate this ability only if you control a Liliana planeswalker.

editions.flavor:
"The nature of this plane makes it almost too easy for me to command the dead."
—Liliana Vess

name: Desolate Lighthouse
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}{R}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: A lonely sentinel facing gales, hurricanes, and tides of homicidal spirits.

name: Desolation
text: At the beginning of each end step, each player who tapped a land for mana this turn sacrifices a land. Desolation deals 2 damage to each player who sacrificed a Plains this way.

editions.flavor:
"Kill a creature, destroy the present. Kill the land, destroy the future."
—Kaervek

name: Desolation Angel
text:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Desolation Angel enters the battlefield, destroy all lands you control. If it was kicked, destroy all lands instead.

name: Desolation Giant
text:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you cast this spell.)
When Desolation Giant enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures you control. If it was kicked, destroy all other creatures instead.

name: Desolation Twin
text: When you cast Desolation Twin, create a 10/10 colorless Eldrazi creature token.

editions.flavor:
"With precise coordination and enough blood spilled, one can be driven off, even brought down. But two . . . that's a lot of blood."
—Munda, ambush leader
"With precise coordination and enough blood spilled, one can be driven off, even brought down. But two . . . that's a lot of blood."—Munda, ambush leader

name: Desperate Charge
text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."
"Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

name: Desperate Gambit
text: Choose a source you control and flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that source would deal damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time it would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Desperate Ravings
text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.
Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.
Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.

name: Desperate Research
text: Name a card other than a basic land card. Then reveal the top seven cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Exile the rest.

name: Desperate Ritual
text:
Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Desperate Sentry
text:
When Desperate Sentry dies, create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.
Delirium — Desperate Sentry gets +3/+0 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

name: Desperate Stand
text:
Strive — Desperate Stand costs {R}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain first strike and vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor: At the Akroan gates, hoplites revived the tactics of Kytheon Iora's infamous irregulars.

name: Despise
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.

editions.flavor:
"Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

"You have returned from fire, traitor. This time I will see you leave as ashes."
—Zurgo, to Sarkhan Vol

"Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Despoil
text: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: Nothing could grow where the vile smoke had been, and no one could breathe it and live.

name: Despoiler of Souls
text:
Despoiler of Souls can't block.
{B}{B}, Exile two other creature cards from your graveyard: Return Despoiler of Souls from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.
Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.

name: Despondency
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-0.
When Despondency is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Despondency to its owner's hand.

name: Despotic Scepter
text: {T}: Destroy target permanent you own. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Destined
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains indestructible until end of turn.

name: Destroy the Evidence
text: Destroy target land. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Everyone knew the Dimir had done the damage. Everyone suspected the Izzet had hired them.

name: Destructive Flow
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a nonbasic land.

editions.flavor: Stage two of the Phyrexian invasion included the complete alteration of Dominaria's landscape.

name: Destructive Force
text: Each player sacrifices five lands. Destructive Force deals 5 damage to each creature.

editions.flavor: The end of the world rarely comes quietly.

name: Destructive Revelry
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Destructive Revelry deals 2 damage to that permanent's controller.

editions.flavor:
"Stoke a fire hot enough and you'll never run out of things to burn."
—Xenagos, the Reveler

"Stoke a fire hot enough and you'll never run out of things to burn."
—Xenagos, the Reveler

name: Destructive Tampering
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I don't think they'll appreciate my . . . adjustments."
—Karavin, renegade saboteur

name: Destructive Urge
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.

editions.flavor: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

name: Destructor Dragon
text:
Flying
When Destructor Dragon dies, destroy target noncreature permanent.

editions.flavor: After countless attacks on the Salt Road where it passes through the frozen tundra, the Abzan began to refer to the area as Atarka territory rather than Temur lands.

name: Detainment Spell
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
{1}{W}: Attach Detainment Spell to target creature.

editions.flavor: Bind the mind rather than the wrist, and you stop the intent to harm before it starts.

name: Detention Sphere
text:
When Detention Sphere enters the battlefield, you may exile target nonland permanent not named Detention Sphere and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent.
When Detention Sphere leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.

name: Determined
text:
Other spells you control can't be countered by spells or abilities this turn.
Draw a card.

name: Detonate
text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

editions.flavor: The goblins have forty-two different words for "ow."

name: Detritivore
text:
Detritivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of nonbasic land cards in your opponents' graveyards.
Suspend X—{X}{3}{R}. X can't be 0. (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {X}{3}{R} and exile it with X time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever a time counter is removed from Detritivore while it's exiled, destroy target nonbasic land.

name: Deus of Calamity
text:
Trample
Whenever Deus of Calamity deals 6 or more damage to an opponent, destroy target land that player controls.

editions.flavor:
"He bears the marks of ages upon his skin, memories of dreams long dead and best left buried."
—The Seer's Parables

"He bears the marks of ages upon his skin, memories of dreams long dead and best left buried."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Devastate
text: Destroy target land. Devastate deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor:
"You're willing to die for your homeland. I'm willing to kill for it."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

name: Devastating Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devastating Dreams, discard X cards at random.
Each player sacrifices X lands. Devastating Dreams deals X damage to each creature.

editions.flavor: Kamahl dreams of storms of fire.

name: Devastating Summons
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devastating Summons, sacrifice X lands.
Create two X/X red Elemental creature tokens.

editions.flavor: Things born in magma are always angry.

name: Devastation
text: Destroy all creatures and lands.

editions.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?
There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?
There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

name: Devastation Tide
text:
Return all nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
Miracle {1}{U} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

editions.flavor: It's hard to argue with a force made of divine will.
It's hard to argue with a force made of divine will.

name: Development
text: Create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token unless any opponent has you draw a card. Repeat this process two more times.

name: Deviant Glee
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has "{R}: This creature gains trample until end of turn."

editions.flavor: "You just need the right incentive to fulfill my dreams."

name: Devil's Play
text:
Devil's Play deals X damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: A devil's hands are never idle.
A devil's hands are never idle.
A devil's hands are never idle.

name: Devils' Playground
text: Create four 1/1 red Devil creature tokens. They have "When this creature dies, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor:
"The city is overrun. I would say burn it to the ground, but that won't be necessary."
—Inquisitor Delmund
On expeditions through Ashmouth, the hunters of Devilthorn Lodge rely on the cleverness of foxes to counteract the mischief of devils.

name: Devoted Caretaker
text: {W}, {T}: Target permanent you control gains protection from instant spells and from sorcery spells until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Her eyes blaze with the strength of twenty shields. Every glance is a salvation.

name: Devoted Crop-Mate
text: You may exert Devoted Crop-Mate as it attacks. When you do, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

name: Devoted Druid
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Put a -1/-1 counter on Devoted Druid: Untap Devoted Druid.

editions.flavor: "Mana lurks in all things, even in the depths of one's own heart."
The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.
The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

name: Devoted Retainer
text: Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: Deep within Eiganjo Castle lay the Palace of Infinite Halls, a seemingly endless network of corridors once guarded by a seemingly endless legion of samurai.

name: Devour Flesh
text: Target player sacrifices a creature, then gains life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: His twisted mind concluded that if he was what he ate, and he wanted to stay human, . . .

name: Devour in Flames
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devour in Flames, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
Devour in Flames deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker.

editions.flavor: Ob Nixilis had prepared for every eventuality—except Chandra Nalaar.

name: Devouring Deep
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: "Full fathom five thy father lies;/ Of his bones are coral made;/ Those are pearls that were his eyes;/ Nothing of him that doth fade,/ But doth suffer a sea-change/ Into something rich and strange." —William Shakespeare, The Tempest

name: Devouring Greed
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devouring Greed, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target player loses 2 life plus 2 life for each Spirit sacrificed this way. You gain that much life.

name: Devouring Light
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Exile target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: Into the light the good are welcomed, and with the light the evil are banished.
"Even your shadow is too foul to tolerate."

name: Devouring Rage
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devouring Rage, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. For each Spirit sacrificed this way, that creature gets an additional +3/+0 until end of turn.

name: Devouring Strossus
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Devouring Strossus.

name: Devouring Swarm
text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Devouring Swarm gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Their arrival is heralded by the deafening hum of ten thousand wings. Their departure is marked by the silence of the dead.

name: Devour in Shadow
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor:
"Feel the burn of the mists. Master them. They will devour your enemies."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Devout Chaplain
text: {T}, Tap two untapped Humans you control: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "By Avacyn's decree, we shall cleanse these relics of their demonic past."

name: Devout Harpist
text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.

editions.flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.

name: Devout Invocation
text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying for each creature tapped this way.

editions.flavor: A prayer to bring demons to their knees.

name: Devout Lightcaster
text:
Protection from black
When Devout Lightcaster enters the battlefield, exile target black permanent.

editions.flavor:
"Goddess, grant us light to banish the world's shadows."
—Prayer to Kamsa

name: Devout Monk
text: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Discipline wears many robes.

name: Devout Witness
text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.
The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.

name: Dewdrop Spy
text:
Flash
Flying
When Dewdrop Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top card of target player's library.

editions.flavor: Only in dew from Oona herself is there clarity enough to see a victim's mind.

name: Dhund Operative
text: As long as you control an artifact, Dhund Operative gets +1/+0 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Baral's spies always have the latest technology.

name: Diabolic Edict
text: Target player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

name: Diabolic Intent
text:
As an additional cost to cast Diabolic Intent, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Diabolic Machine
text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.

editions.flavor: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning." —Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

name: Diabolic Revelation
text: Search your library for up to X cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"There are some secrets so dark no human mind should ever contain them. Interested?"
—Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis

name: Diabolic Servitude
text:
When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.
When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.

name: Diabolic Tutor
text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.

"Show them. Show them how hot your fire can burn."
—Liliana Vess, to Chandra Nalaar

name: Diabolic Vision
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Diamond Faerie
text:
Flying
{1}{S}: Snow creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

editions.flavor:
"That such delicate creatures could become so powerful in the embrace of winter is yet more proof that I am right."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Diamond Faerie Avatar
text: {S}: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: CSP Participation Avatar

name: Diamond Kaleidoscope
text:
{3}, {T}: Create a 0/1 colorless Prism artifact creature token.
Sacrifice a Prism token: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"A pretty toy. Now show me its tactical applications."
—Telim'Tor

name: Diamond Valley
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

name: Diaochan, Artful Beauty
text: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Dichotomancy
text:
For each tapped nonland permanent target opponent controls, search that player's library for a card with the same name as that permanent and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Suspend 3—{1}{U}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{U}{U} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Dictate of Erebos
text:
Flash
Whenever a creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: "I take no pleasure in your suffering, but it is necessary. Once you accept your fate you'll find eternity more tolerable."

name: Dictate of Heliod
text:
Flash
Creatures you control get +2/+2.

editions.flavor:
"In our war Heliod gave mortals some favor, yet other times he withheld aid. Are we still no more than game pieces to him?"
—Polyxene the Doubter

"In our war Heliod gave mortals some favor, yet other times he withheld aid. Are we still no more than game pieces to him?"
—Polyxene the Doubter
"In our war Heliod gave mortals some favor, yet other times he withheld aid. Are we still no more than game pieces to him?"—Polyxene the Doubter

name: Dictate of Karametra
text:
Flash
Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor: "I refuse to let the folly of mortals endanger the home I made for them."

name: Dictate of Kruphix
text:
Flash
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.

editions.flavor: "Knowledge is cruel. It will break your heart and test your allegiances. Are you certain you want this curse?"
